tweets.html:
Oh, no! LUCK without horses would be like Boardwalk Empire without the boardwalk! So...basically like the second season of Boardwalk Empire.

"Portlandia" renewed for 3rd season. News greeted with spontaneous burst of shrugs and awkward sidelong glances.

Good Wife renewal is not surprising, but it is heartening; CBS wants an awards drama, and it's thankfully their only option. #IWillTakeIt

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) March 14, 2012

Yes! 60 Minutes got renewed! That was a real nail-biter. #somethingmygrandmawouldsay

— Shay (@LetItPlayOut) March 14, 2012

You know what the 2 Broke Girls renewal means? More MPK at TCA! #probablynot

— Marisa Roffman (@marisaroffman) March 14, 2012

CBS renewed so many darned shows the network accidentally ordered S.2 of "Viva Laughlin."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2012

The #CBSRenewal slate reminds me I should really start watching #TheGoodWife. I can never find a S1 DVD set at my local game/video store.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 14, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
CBS is so cocky, they changed their name to Comedy Central and bought the syndication rights to Community just to toy with that show's fans.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) March 14, 2012

*FLAILING* #TheGoodWife has been renewed for a fourth season!!! So glad I sacrificed my horse to the TV Gods. Worth it!

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) March 14, 2012

If your favorite CBS show wasn't renewed today, CBS is mocking you: http://t.co/Q4K1GOEF

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2012

If NBC wanted to make fans as happy as CBS did today, they'd instantly renew #Parenthood, #Community, and #ParksandRec.

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) March 14, 2012

Congrats @GoodWifeWriters on your renewal! I look forward to spending many more Sunday nights far more emotionally invested than is healthy.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) March 14, 2012

CBS' renewal announcement today is the equivalent of Chris Rock throwing his mic down after a routine. "HOW YA LIKE ME NOW, BITCHEZ?"

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) March 14, 2012

This is a worrisome day to be a fan of "¡Rob!" Even worse than usual, I mean.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2012

Everybody remember that what CBS did today is weird + CBS-y and won't incite other networks to do similar things.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2012

Rules of Engagement is the low self-esteem girl that CBS dials up for a booty call every once in a while - and then doesn't call for months.

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) March 14, 2012

Based on #CBSRenewal slate, my theory is every remaining show is a sacrificial lamb to the pilot gods. They die so others may live.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 14, 2012

Kind of want to watch The Killing just so I can join in the twitdignation. #FeelingLeftOut

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) March 14, 2012

The best way for NBC to burn all bridges? Announce the #Smash spinoff "Ellis Island" while canceling #Community.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 14, 2012

Q: Which MAD MEN cast member's name is the most fun to say in a Jabba The Hutt voice? A: Kiernan Shipka

— DC Pierson (@DCpierson) March 14, 2012

#Parenthood outperforms Fashion Star. Just sayin, NBC. @#ahem #renewal

— Lesley Goldberg (@Snoodit) March 14, 2012

Can't imagine ABC's "Missing" (also on CTV if you haven't noticed the ads) will be repetitive & boring...she's a mother looking for her son!

— Will Dixon (@wcdixon) March 14, 2012

I'll only touch your shirt? Is that code for clitoris???? If so I'm lookin' for a One Hour Martinizer my damn self! What what! #Smash

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) March 14, 2012

I'm going to keep this show on. Even if we do it in my yard. You watch...

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 14, 2012

Umm...that means I will be sitting in ur yard watching. Get ready. RT @VDOOZER I'm going to keep this show on. Even if we do it in my yard.

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) March 14, 2012

ABC: further incentive to NOT cancel my favorite show -- Bill Lawrence does not want me in his yard. Because that would be weird.

You guys are right. Actresses aren't crazy. RT @MelanieGriffith: I have been looking into Quantum Jumping. Any body interested in this?

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) March 14, 2012

See, Ivy needs a swift backhand. YOU WERE TO DIVA FOR THE BAR MITZVAH. Go drink your honey tea and rehearse! Uggghhh #Annoying #Smash

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) March 14, 2012

Is there any job he won't take? RT @samthielman: James Franco will be in "Hollywood Heights," a Televisa-produced novela on @Nickelodeon

— Alex Weprin (@alexweprin) March 14, 2012

Breaking In is perfectly fine.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) March 14, 2012

@corybarker Ugh, stop fishing for pull quotes, Barker. GAWD.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) March 14, 2012

Filming of the 24 movie is delayed due to Kiefer's commitment to Touch. Only so much grunting a guy can do at one time.

— Matthew Gilbert (@MatthewGilbert) March 14, 2012

Apparently the "I can't find TruTV!!!" jokes got renewed for a second season.

— SpottedRatings.com (@spotupj) March 14, 2012

I honestly can't even bring myself to watch last night's 90210. I'm 90210ver it.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) March 15, 2012

"Bully" got rated all-ages in Canada. They've always been a harbor for youth-corruption. #blamecanada

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) March 15, 2012

Three horses have died on the set of LUCK. All on surfboards for the overly ambitious filming of a John from Cincinnati crossover episode.

— Michael Neal (@slapclap) March 14, 2012

Not to worry guys. Netflix will totally step in and save the 24 movie. #eightseasonsandamovie

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) March 14, 2012

It's weird that one horse death would stop production on LUCK. Nick Nolte died three years ago and *that* didn't seem to be a problem.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) March 14, 2012

The Lesson of Luck: DOn't kill horses on shows that no one can understand what the hell youre talking about

— Richard Rushfield (@richardrushfield) March 14, 2012

They shoot (HBO series), don't they? #luck

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) March 14, 2012

You're telling me all we needed to cancel Entourage earlier was a couple of horses?

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) March 14, 2012

The same thing happened to John From Cincinnati, but with surfers. #Luck.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) March 14, 2012

Cue every luck-related pun ever conceived by the human brain. #Luck

I would have thought they would have just recast the horses with Ashton Kutcher. #Luck

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) March 14, 2012

tweets.html:
It's just like Deadwood, but instead of wood, it's horses. #Luck #canceled

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) March 14, 2012

I'm so glad there aren't horses on Treme.

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) March 14, 2012

No one even cared how many horses were killed for a typical episode of The Hills

— Richard Rushfield (@richardrushfield) March 14, 2012

Right decision to cancel Luck. I've no idea why more horses die in a show about horse racing than horse racing.

— Tom Wilson (@tomwilson23) March 14, 2012

Man, that makes three David Milch shows killed early. That's bad lu... no, I suppose it's too soon for that joke. #Luck

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 14, 2012

Not to be an ass, but if Luck had True Blood's ratings, it probably doesn't get canceled. Right?

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) March 14, 2012

And now we realize why FOX really canceled #TerraNova: too many dinosaurs died while filming. #RIPLuck

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 14, 2012

In brighter news, a lot of really good actors are now available for pilots!

NBC Cancelled Prime Suspect due to the abuse of stylish hats. #RIPHats

"@andylevy: HBO decides to cease all future production of LUCK after third horse death" But where will Hoffman's glue and Jell-O come from?

It's sad to know we're still 3 horse deaths away from 2 Broke Girls being canceled.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 14, 2012

Milch is really regretting his decision to go with horses and not greyhounds right about now. #Luck

With Milch, Hoffman, and Mann, who would have guessed that the horses would have been the biggest prima donnas? #Luck

HBO cancels LUCK because of horse deaths. Horses actually committed suicide when they heard they were on the same network as Entourage.

I understand they had to cancel Luck but I don't get why it was considered humane to kill Dustin Hoffman right there on the set.

In horse language "luck" translates to "nightmare murder time."

Now we'll never get a Luck S2 Horsicide Special where all the ladies (or both ladies) agree the bravest thing to do is air another season.

Great point raised: Real Housewives didn't cancel for a human death -- Luck did for Horses.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) March 14, 2012

They shoot CGI horses, don't they?

Never seen a dead horse kill a TV series before: RT @WaPoTeamTV: HBO cancels ‘Luck’ after third horse death [Updated] http://t.co/mBTuQcUn

What does the cancellation of LUCK mean for other slow-paced and dense horse-racing dramas?

I'm glad I'm not gonna be the one who has to explain to Nick Nolte what happened with "Luck."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2012

Two years from now check my twitter. It will be 24 months of 'LUCK canceled because of 3rd horse death' tweets.

I have a better chance of surviving as a horse on #LUCK than getting through this movie alive #watchingNEWYEARSEVE

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) March 14, 2012

What would the young cajun jockey say about the Luck cancellation? We'll never know... because we could never understand him.

I fear more people are reading about #Luck's cancellation than actually watched the series.

— Lesley Goldberg (@Snoodit) March 14, 2012

I've been skimming the news today, but: I can't believe Marc Cherry killed all those horses on "Luck".

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) March 14, 2012

New rule- shows only get canceled when they have 3 horses die.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) March 14, 2012

Rick Kissell weighs in on #Luck: "You can lead a horse to slaughter, but you can’t make them watch."

You're all savages! RT @awallenstein: Rick Kissell weighs in on #Luck: "You can lead a horse to slaughter, but you can’t make them watch."

— Stuart Levine (@Stus_Views) March 14, 2012

I was just beginning to catch up on #Luck as well. The racing scenes were the best I've ever seen filmed. It's a shame what happened.

"How many horses do I have to kill to get [name of show you dislike] canceled????" #joketemplate

— Muffin MacGuffin🕯 (@MuffMacGuff) March 14, 2012

@MuffMacGuff I'd say "Modern Family", but they're doing a pretty good job beating a dead horse and nobody's worked up over it. (Zing!)

— Steve Spillman (@spillman) March 14, 2012

I suppose HBO had to cancel #Luck: one more horse death and Pestilence, War, Famine, and Death could have saddled up for the Apocalypse.

Might have just been my love of degenerate gamblers, but I really enjoyed "Luck." Hard to argue with the "Shouldn't kill animals" reasoning.

"Luck" was cancelled after 3 horses and countless viewers were put to sleep

I think the dude from 'Hung' killed those horses cos he was pissed he didn't have the biggest penis on HBO anymore #LUCK

@franklinavenue Dustin Hoffman gives up horse racing, but can't find a job. Inherits failing chicken farm. "CLUCK"

I defy late-night TV hosts to come up with better #Luck jokes than tweets i've seen over the last 20 minutes. But i'd like to seem them try

The "In Memorium" segment of The Emmys should be real interesting this year now back to #watchingNEWYEARSEVE

A horse walks into a bar. The bartender says "Hey I thought you died on the set of HBO's 'Luck'."

Wish HBO had killed the cast of Entourage instead.

Celebrity horses always die in threes :(

Horse deaths lead to "Luck" cancellation. To be safe, next season of "Game of Thrones" to feature lots of walking & razor scooters.

Technically, if they want to salvage the cast, I suppose they could make #Luck S2 an #AmericanHorrorStory equivalent with brand-new setting.

ugh. quit with the luck jokes.

BRING BACK DEADWOOD INSTEAD

soooo...how many dead Starks will it take to cancel Game Of Thrones?

Luck should've just hired Joey from War Horse. That horse could go through anything.

Is it true HBO killed a horse so they'd have an excuse to cancel "Luck"? Thank goodness I work for Fox.

I KNEW my motorcycle "accident" was no such thing! QT @maskedscheduler (At Fox) ... We off showrunners.

"Tell Mr. Ed I said hello." - Dustin Hoffman, horse whisperer

HBO may also cancel GAME OF THRONES over the amount of decapitations. Some good actors are being lost there.

Not even almighty HBO can prop up a show about which the best a fan can say is, "It gets good once you get past the first 6 episodes" #LUCK

Oh God no, apparently the last horse to perish on the set of "Luck" was several months pregnant with Nick Nolte's centaur baby.

Why would Andrew Luck go on a horse-killing spree? Thats going to hurt his draft stock, if he literally wants to kill the Broncos.

I'm not sure I like this Survivor: New World twist, unless it involves smallpox or typhoid.

Strike everything I said already: "I smell a butt coming" is the line of the season. #survivor

Gotta love #AmericanIdol turning constant's lying about criminal record into a cliffhanger to keep you watching...

this is atrocious. #Idol
